sources.title: "A Kentucky Feud" (1905)
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     This is a short preview. You can watch the whole film here: https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/index.php/gems-for-donation   "A Kentucky Feud" is a short Western drama.  The film is included in our program to illustrate the work of Billy Bitzer, a star of Silent Hall of Fame. Directed by                       unknown Cinematography by         Billy Bitzer Starring                             unknown Distributed by                   Biograph Company Release date                       November 7, 1905 Country                             United States Running time                    8 m.   Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. Fair use is a use permitted by copyright statute that might otherwise be infringing. Non-profit, educational or personal use tips the balance in favor of fair use."

metadata.Plot: When Jim Hatfield beats Buddy McCoy for stealing some apples, it begins a bitter feud between their two families. Soon afterwards, at an auction, Buddy takes a shot at Jim, and accidentally kills Jim's mother. Sally McCoy and Jim are in love with each other, further complicating the situation. As feelings become inflamed on both sides, a full-scale blood feud erupts.
